intro: Emmenosperma micropetalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emmenosperma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are densely arranged along its stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals, and are clustered in inflorescences. Emmenosperma micropetalum is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
